title: Paracetamol (Acetaminophen)
content: Paracetamol is a common painkiller used to treat aches and pain. It can also reduce fever. It's available over the counter and is safe when taken correctly.
dosage: Adults: 500mg to 1g every 4-6 hours, maximum 4g in 24 hours. Do not exceed recommended dose.
warnings: Do not exceed maximum daily dose
Check other medications for paracetamol content

title: Ibuprofen
content: Ibuprofen is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It reduces inflammation and pain, and can also reduce fever. Available over the counter for short-term use.
dosage: Adults: 200-400mg three times daily with food. Maximum 1200mg daily for OTC use.
warnings: Take with food to reduce stomach upset
Not suitable for people with stomach ulcers
Caution with asthma, kidney or heart problems

title: Aspirin (Acetylsalicylic Acid)
content: Aspirin is used to reduce pain, fever, and inflammation. Low-dose aspirin is also used to prevent heart attacks and strokes in high-risk individuals.
uses: Heart attack and stroke prevention (low dose)
During a heart attack (if advised by emergency services)
dosage: Pain/fever: 300-650mg every 4-6 hours. Heart protection: 75-100mg daily (doctor prescribed).
warnings: Not for children under 16 (Reye's syndrome risk)

title: Antihistamines
content: Antihistamines are medications that help relieve allergy symptoms by blocking histamine. They can be sedating (drowsy) or non-sedating types.

title: Antacids
content: Antacids are medications that neutralize stomach acid. They provide quick relief for heartburn, acid reflux, and indigestion.
warnings: May affect absorption of other medications
Take 1-2 hours apart from other drugs
Not for long-term regular use without doctor advice
High sodium types: caution with high blood pressure

title: Cough Medicines
content: Cough medicines can help relieve coughing symptoms. There are two main types: expectorants (help bring up mucus) and suppressants (reduce the urge to cough).

title: Decongestants
content: Decongestants reduce nasal congestion by narrowing blood vessels in the nasal passages. Available as oral tablets or nasal sprays.
warnings: Not for people with high blood pressure, heart disease
Nasal sprays: use max 7 days to avoid rebound
Caution with diabetes, thyroid problems, glaucoma
